content: That is an indication that it is the wrong password. If that password works when logging in online in browser, that is an indication that your email provider requires a separate password for email clients.
creator: davidsk

content: Open your profile folder, Quit Thunderbird then delete the session.json file from the profile folder. This file is where information about opened tabs is stored, so that they can reopen when Thunderbird starts, so delete it so that Thunderbird "forgets" about those many tabs you accidentally opened. For more information about your Thunderbird profile, see Profiles - Where Thunderbird stores your messages and other user data
creator: stancestans

content: THere is one safe procedure: - exit thunderbird on old pc - copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to an external drive - create thunderbird on new setup and exit - copy the exported thunderbird profile to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overwrite the default thunderbird folder that was created in setup - restart thunderbird

content:
Here are the steps: - log onto your gmail account on the web - click the gear wheel in upper right and then click 'see all settings' - One of the menu options is 'accounts and import' - click that - The 3rd or 4th option on the list is 'import mail and contacts' - click there and you will be prompted for email and password for each account.

If Gmail is unable to locate the account, you may have to resort to logging into the account to be forwarded and see if that email provider has the option to forward mail. That would also work.
creator: davidsk

content:
Feedback and ideas should be placed in the appropriate forum. The link is on the help menu in Thunderbird several lines after the link to this forum.

To save time it directs you to https://connect.mozilla.org

This is a peer support forum. Developers are a bit like Martians here. Reputed to exist, but never been seen.

Just an FYI though. Ctrl+K search is not a new feature. It has been in Thunderbird for a long time, sitting in the middle of the toolbar. So long in fact it is 14 years since someone asked that open as a list be offered as a user choice over the faceted search results. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=580252

content:
IMAP requires an IMAP expunge server side to do what a simple compact does on a POP mail account. Generally Thunderbird issues an expunge with a compact of IMAP accounts and also on exit for the inbox. But the expunge on exit needs to be selected and I have seen folk disable it because they do not know what it is. I also see a lot of folk with failed compacts because their antivirus gets in on the process and causes failure before completion. This usually leaves NSTMP folders in the all folders view, but not always.

So if your compacts are working I have no real Idea. but I am guessing the expunge part of the process is not. One way to check is to turn on just mark it as deleted in account settings and see if your folders are full of deleted mail with a strikethrough.
creator: MattAuSupport

If you have no menu bar, press F10 to make it visible so you can use it.

content: go to tools>addons and see if you have a dark theme applied. Also check to see if you have any extension addons that set dark mode. These are the usual two areas for dark mode. A final place to check would be if you have CSS statements in a userControl.css file stored in a folder named chrome in your profile.
